comments:
Since I don't appear to be the only one, see stacktrace I get in the .metadate/.log
in http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.tools.jdt/msg06451.html

I've been using eclipse 2.1.2. without any problems.

Unfortunately, the 3.0 M6 zip file doesn't have an installer that would be
recognized and executed by winzip and the eclipse/readme/readme_eclipse.html is
not yet updated for v3.0 .

So, I just installed the zip over the 2.1.2 installation and used the same start
command as before under cygwin:
#!/bin/bash
export JAVA_HOME=`cygpath -d $JAVA_HOME`
eclipse.exe -vm `cygpath -d $JAVA_HOME/bin/javaw.exe` -data `cygpath -d
eclipse/workspace` -vmargs -Xmx128m $@ &


java version "1.4.2_02"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_02-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2_02-b03, mixed mode)

oh well, I am going to wipe my "eclipse" dir entirely and re-unpack the backup
zip again ...  - so much about user friendliness ...  :(

Eclipse should not be upgraded by unzipping the new install over-top the old
one. See the readme.html for more details and how to use the "-data"
command-line argument.

As is recommended in the file, you should:
- find your workspace directory
- copy it to another location (e.g. c:\myworkspace)
- unzip the new Eclipse install to a fresh directory (or completely delete the
old one before using the same named dir)
- start Eclipse with the "-data c:\myworkspace" arguments
